challenges.title: Welcome to the WorkBench
description:
Welcome to the WorkBench.

Click the 'Go to my next step' button to continue.

Great! This is how you will complete several lessons, by reading and clicking next.

Please always read and understand every word before continuing.

You will keep going through each step until you get to the 'Finish lesson' button.

When you click 'Finish lesson' the next lesson will start.

challenges.title: The Lesson Types
description:
There are different types of lessons.

Some are steps to read like these.

Some are videos to watch.

Others are coding lessons where you will write code.
Also, there will be commitments to make along the way and finally projects to complete.

challenges.title: ** Commit to Read and Understand
description: It is critical that you do not skim the reading.

Commit to read and understand all the words in each lesson.

Click the 'Confirm' button below to unlock the next step.

challenges.title: The WorkBench Windows
description: There are 4 different windows that are used for the WorkBench.

They are:

'All Lessons'
'Lesson'
'Code Editor'
'Preview'

Not all lessons use all of the windows.

You can show and hide these windows by clicking on their buttons on the upper right in the Navigation Bar.
We suggest you hide the 'All Lessons' window so that you have more room to read and write code.

challenges.title: Coding Lessons
description:
On a coding lesson you must complete the requested objective.

You complete the task by clicking the 'Run Tests' button found in the 'Lesson' window.
When you click 'Run Tests' a series of tests will run to check if you have met the coding objective.

If you have not passed all the tests then read the error messages to get information on what to correct.

Keep correcting and testing your work.

Re-read the lesson to get more help.

Some lessons can be very challenging, and you may get stuck.

We will teach you later how to get help.

If necessary you can use the 'All Lessons' window to skip to the next lesson.

challenges.title: Try to Code
description: Here you will get a lesson on coding.
In this lesson you will just change some text in the code editor.
<hr>
Here you will get the coding objective.
Change the text between the <h2> and </h2> to say "Hello World".
challengeSeed: <!-- This is the 'Code Editor' window. You can type here. -->
Look at the window to the right. The text will look large and dark. That is the 'Preview' window.

tests.text: The h2 should have the text "Hello World".

challenges.title: ** Commit to Learn in Order
description: Just like in math, many parts of coding build upon previous knowledge.
These lessons have been created in a specific order to help your knowledge build.
Commit do the lessons in order and not jump ahead.

challenges.title: Coding Tips
description:
Coding is very specific.

Here are some tips for when you get stuck.

All coding is case sensitive.

This means that hello and Hello are two different words.

Always check your casing.

Read the error messages.

Error messages are sometimes very literal.

Read and re-read all the available error messages.

Coding uses symbols.

count = 1; is different from count = 1,

Keep an eye out for symbol typos.

Delete some work and check again.

When fixing a problem, make the problem smaller by temporarily deleting other unrelated code.

challenges.title: ** Commit to not solve other students problems - WorkBench
description: Computer programming requires excellent problem solving skills.
When students give help it should only be to point out where in the documentation, books or other materials they can learn about a concept.
Students should never give away a solution to a problem or share code that completes a problem.
If you and the other student have finished the project or lesson than feel free to discuss, share techniques and share code.
However, please do not discuss within earshot of other students that have not finished.
Commit to not solve other students problems, share code or give away answers.
